statements.name: PROC CPORT

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a SAS catalog.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a is a SAS data set.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a SAS library.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the specific catalog, SAS data set, or SAS library to export. If source-type is CATALOG or DATA, you can specify both a libref and a member name. If the libref is omitted, PROC CPORT uses the default library as the libref, which is usually the WORK library. If the source-type argument is LIBRARY, specify only a libref. If you specify a library, PROC CPORT exports only data sets and catalogs from that library. You cannot export other types of files.

arguments.name: <libref.>member-name
arguments.description: specifies the specific catalog, SAS data set, or SAS library to export. If source-type is CATALOG or DATA, you can specify both a libref and a member name. If the libref is omitted, PROC CPORT uses the default library as the libref, which is usually the WORK library. If the source-type argument is LIBRARY, specify only a libref. If you specify a library, PROC CPORT exports only data sets and catalogs from that library. You cannot export other types of files.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: exports copies of all data sets or catalog entries that have a modification date equal to or later than the date that you specify.

arguments.name: ASIS
arguments.description: suppresses the conversion of displayed character data to transport format.

arguments.name: CONSTRAINT=
arguments.description: controls the exportation of integrity constraints.

arguments.name: DATECOPY
arguments.description: copies the created and modified date and time to the transport file.

arguments.name: EET=
arguments.description: excludes specified entry types from the transport file.

arguments.name: ET=
arguments.description: includes specified entry types in the transport file.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the transport file to write to.

arguments.name: GENERATION=
arguments.description: specifies whether to export all generations of a data set.

arguments.name: INDEX=
arguments.description: controls the exportation of indexes with indexed SAS data sets.

arguments.name: INTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of DBCS data stored in the SAS files to be exported.
arguments.help: INTYPE=IBM | HITAC | FACOM | DEC | SJIS | PCIBM

arguments.name: IBM
arguments.description: for z/OS or VSE

arguments.name: HITAC
arguments.description: for z/OS

arguments.name: FACOM
arguments.description: for z/OS

arguments.name: DEC
arguments.description: for OpenVMS

arguments.name: SJIS
arguments.description: for OpenVMS or OS/2

arguments.name: PCIBM
arguments.description: for OS/2

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies that only data sets, only catalogs, or both, be moved when a library is exported.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: both catalogs and data sets

arguments.name: CATALOG
arguments.description: catalogs

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: SAS data sets

arguments.name: NOCOMPRESS
arguments.description: suppresses the compression of binary zeros and blanks in the transport file.

arguments.name: NOEDIT
arguments.description: exports SAS/AF PROGRAM and SCL entries without Edit capability when you import them.

arguments.name: NOSRC
arguments.description: specifies that exported catalog entries contain compiled SCL code, but not the source code.

arguments.name: OUTLIB=
arguments.description: specifies a libref associated with a SAS library.

arguments.name: OUTTYPE=
arguments.description: writes all alphabetic characters to the transport file in uppercase.

arguments.name: TAPE
arguments.description: directs the output from PROC CPORT to a tape.

arguments.name: TRANSLATE=
arguments.description: translates specified characters from one ASCII or EBCDIC value to another.

statements.name: EXCLUDE
statements.description: Excludes specified files or entries from the transport file.
statements.help:
EXCLUDE  SAS file(s)  | catalog entry(s) </ MEMTYPE=mtype>
	 </ ENTRYTYPE=entry-type>;

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files to be excluded from the transport file. Specify SAS filenames when you export a SAS library; specify catalog entry names when you export an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the EXCLUDE statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files to be excluded from the transport file. Specify SAS filenames when you export a SAS library; specify catalog entry names when you export an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the EXCLUDE statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single entry type for the catalog entries listed in the EXCLUDE statement. See .

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single member type for one or more SAS files listed in the EXCLUDE statement. Valid values are CATALOG, DATA, or ALL. If you do not specify the MEMTYPE= option in the EXCLUDE statement, then processing is restricted to those member types specified in the MEMTYPE= option in the PROC CPORT statement.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Includes specified files or entries in the transport file.
statements.help:
SELECT  SAS file(s) | catalog entry(s)</ MEMTYPE=mtype>
	 </ ENTRYTYPE=entry-type> ;

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to be included in the transport file. Specify SAS filenames when you export a SAS library; specify catalog entry names when you export an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the SELECT statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to be included in the transport file. Specify SAS filenames when you export a SAS library; specify catalog entry names when you export an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the SELECT statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single entry type for the catalog entries listed in the SELECT statement. See See . for a complete list of catalog entry types.

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single member type for one or more SAS files listed in the SELECT statement. Valid values are CATALOG, DATA, or ALL. If you do not specify the MEMTYPE= option in the SELECT statement, then processing is restricted to those member types specified in the MEMTYPE= option in the PROC CPORT statement.

statements.name: TRANTAB
statements.description: Specifies translation tables for characters in catalog entries that you export.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the translation table to use.
